aweSOM 0.2.1

Screeplot

aweSOMscreeplot.Rd

Creates a screeplot that that provides a quality measurement of the quality of the clustering of each SOM cell for both PAM and hierarchical clustering.

aweSOMscreeplot(
  ok.som,
  nclass = 2,
  method = "hierarchical",
  hmethod = "ward.D2"
)

Arguments

ok.som

SOM data object
nclass

number of superclasses to be visualized in the screeplot. Default is 2.
method

Method used for clustering. Hierarchical clustering ("hierarchical") and PAM ("pam") clustering can be used. By default hierarchical clustering is applied.
hmethod

Specifically for hierarchicical clustering, the clustering method can be specified. By default "ward.D2" is used for other options, see the stats::hclust method documentation.

Value

Screeplot

Examples

#' ok.data <- iris
## Build training data
dat <- ok.data[,c("Sepal.Length", "Sepal.Width",  "Petal.Length", "Petal.Width" )]

#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'ok.data' not found
### Scale training data
dat <- scale(dat)

#> Error in scale(dat): object 'dat' not found
## Train SOM
### RNG Seed (for reproducibility)
### Initialization (PCA grid)
init <- aweSOM::somInit(dat, 4, 4)

#> Error in prcomp(traindat, center = F, scale. = F): object 'dat' not found
ok.som <- kohonen::som(dat, grid = kohonen::somgrid(4, 4, 'hexagonal'), rlen = 100, alpha = c(0.05, 0.01), radius = c(6.08,-6.08), init = init, dist.fcts = 'sumofsquares')

#> Error in check.data(data): object 'dat' not found
## Group cells into superclasses (PAM clustering)
superclust <- cluster::pam(ok.som$codes[[1]], 2)

#> Error in inherits(x, "dist"): object 'ok.som' not found
superclasses <- unname(superclust$clustering)

#> Error in unname(superclust$clustering): object 'superclust' not found
aweSOM::aweSOMscreeplot(ok.som, method = 'hierarchical', hmethod = 'ward.D2', nclass = 2)

#> Error in aweSOM::aweSOMscreeplot(ok.som, method = "hierarchical", hmethod = "ward.D2",     nclass = 2): object 'ok.som' not found
